newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian stocks fall, Unibanka slides further.
newsitem.headline: Latvian stocks fall, Unibanka slides further.

text.p: Latvian stock volumes fell on Tuesday and Unibanka started its second consecutive week of losses, dealers said.
Total turnover was 100,000 lats versus 175,000 lats and Rietumu bank's bourse index dipped 2.71 percent to 222.52.
Leading share Unibanka continued its slide, which began after it cancelled a merger with Zemes Banka.
It fell to 4.64 from 4.75 lats on volume of 14,400 lats.
Riga Transport Fleet on the official list was the most traded stock on volume of 30,200 lats as it advanced two santimes to 1.76 lats.
Staburadze confectionery was also in demand as it jumped 18 santimes to 2.88 lats. It turned over 14,800.
On the secondary list Kaija Fish cannery registered business of 21,000 lats as it edged up by one santime to 2.37 lats.
Daugavpils Chain maker fell 42 santimes or 15 percent to 2.38 lats on volume of 7,900 lats.
The market is still unclear whether Daugavpils will issue bonus shares as other companies have done.
Ogre Forestry advanced 12 santimes to 0.92 santimes on trade of 3,800 lats.
Elsewhere on the market activity was minimal, with small volumes which made price fluctuations more pronounced.
Valmiera Glassfibre closed 15 santimes lower at 1.85 lats and traded 1,900 lats, while Lode Brick added six santimes to 2.86 lats and saw shares worth 1,200 lats change hands.
Liepaja Fish cannery fell to 1.28 lats from 1.50 lats or almost 15 percent on small volume of 500 lats.
